itemDescription: British Anglican priest and theological writer

wikipedia_page.main: John Penrose (15 December 1778 – 9 August 1859) was a Church of England clergyman and theological writer.

response: *December 15 – John Penrose, Church of England clergyman and theologian (died 1859)

Penrose was born at Bracebridge, Lincolnshire, the third son of Rev. John Penrose who was vicar there, and his wife Elizabeth Cartwright. His mother was the daughter of Edmund Cartwright and a teacher and author of children's books under the name Mrs Markham.
John Penrose (born 1964) is the British Conservative Member of Parliament (MP) for Weston-super-Mare.
John Penrose may also refer to:
*John Penrose (MP for Liskeard), in 1411, MP for Liskeard (parliamentary borough)
*John Penrose (journalist), British journalist, former husband of Anne Robinson

link_mentions.page: List of Corpus Christi College, Oxford people
response: * John Penrose – clergyman and theological writer
